item.title: Lindsay add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "Oh, it's always the same,' she sighed, 'if you want men to behave well to you, you must be beastly to them; if you treat them decently they make you suffer for it." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "It was one of the queer things of life that you saw a person every day for months and were so intimate with him that you could not imagine existence without him; then separation came, and everything went on in the same way, and the companion who had seemed essential proved unnecessary." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "Insensibly he formed the most delightful habit in the world, the habit of reading: he did not know that thus he was providing himself with a refuge from all the distress of life; he did not know either that he was creating for himself an unreal world which would make the real world of every day a source of bitter disappointment." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "There's such a lot of different Annes in me. I sometimes think that is why I'm such a troublesome person. If I was just the one Anne it would be ever so much more comfortable, but then it wouldn't be half so interesting." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "Miss Barry was a kindred spirit after all," Anne confided to Marilla, "You wouldn't think so to look at her, but she is. . . Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Kindred spirits are not so scarce as I used to think. It's splendid to find out there are so many of them in the world." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Anne always remembered the silvery, peaceful beauty and fragrant calm of that night. It was the last night before sorrow touched her life; and no life is ever quite the same again when once that cold, sanctifying touch has been laid upon it." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Nick Hornby
item.description: "This thing about looking for someone less different... It only really worked, he realized, if you were convinced that being you wasn't so bad in the first place." -- Nick Hornby

item.title: Lindsay add a quote by Katherine Applegate
item.description: "Right now I would give all the yogurt raisins in all the world for a heart made of ice." -- Katherine Applegate
